qas.question: What is the primary function of the USAF fighter aircraft?
What is the name of a type of dual purpose fighter-bomber aircraft used by the US Air Force?
What aircraft is used by the US Air Demonstration group The Thunderbirds?
What kind of aircraft is utilized by the USAF in Full Scale Aerial Targets?
What are the QF-4 aircraft being replaced by the US Air Force?

answers.text: early model F-16 aircraft converted to QF-16 configuration

context: The fighter aircraft of the USAF are small, fast, and maneuverable military aircraft primarily used for <a0_0>air-to-air combat<a0_0/>. Many of these fighters have secondary ground-attack capabilities, and some are dual-roled as fighter-bombers (e.g., the <a1_0>F-16 Fighting Falcon<a1_0/>); the term "fighter" is also sometimes used colloquially for dedicated ground-attack aircraft. Other missions include interception of bombers and other fighters, reconnaissance, and patrol. The <a2_0>F-16<a2_0/> is currently used by the USAF Air Demonstration squadron, the Thunderbirds, while a small number of both man-rated and non-man-rated <a3_0>F-4 Phantom II<a3_0/> are retained as QF-4 aircraft for use as Full Scale Aerial Targets (FSAT) or as part of the USAF Heritage Flight program. These extant QF-4 aircraft are being replaced in the FSAT role by <a4_0>early model F-16 aircraft converted to QF-16 configuration<a4_0/>. The USAF has 2,025 fighters in service as of September 2012.
